text:
धृतराष्ट्र उवाच

धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः।

मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय।।1.1।।
title: Verse 1
transliteration: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca dharmakṣetre kurukṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāścaiva kimakurvata sañjaya
word_meanings: dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca—Dhritarashtra said; dharmakṣetre—the land of dharma; kurukṣetre—at Kurukshetra; samavetā—having gathered; yuyutsavaḥ—desiring to fight; māmakāḥ—my sons; pāṇḍavāḥ—the sons of Pandu; ca—and; eva—certainly; kim—what; akurvata—did they do; sañjaya—Sanjay

text:
सञ्जय उवाच

दृष्ट्वा तु पाण्डवानीकं व्यूढं दुर्योधनस्तदा।

आचार्यमुपसङ्गम्य राजा वचनमब्रवीत्।।1.2।।
title: Verse 2
transliteration: sañjaya uvāca dṛṣṭvā tu pāṇḍavānīkaṃ vyūḍhaṃ duryodhanastadā ācāryamupasaṅgamya rājā vacanamabravīt
word_meanings: sañjaya uvāca—Sanjay said; dṛṣṭvā—on observing; tu—but; pāṇḍavānīkaṃ—the Pandava army; vyūḍhaṃ—standing in a military formation; duryodhanaḥ—King Duryodhan; tadā—then; ācāryam—teacher; upasaṅgamya—approached; rājā—the king; vacanam—words; abravīt—spoke

text:
पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम्।

व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता।।1.3।।
title: Verse 3
transliteration: paśyaitāṃ pāṇḍuputrāṇāmācārya mahatīṃ camūm vyūḍhāṃ drupadaputreṇa tava śiṣyeṇa dhīmatā
word_meanings: paśya—behold; etāṃ—this; pāṇḍuputrāṇām—of the sons of Pandu; ācārya—respected teacher; mahatīṃ—mighty; camūm—army; vyūḍhāṃ—arrayed in a military formation; drupadaputreṇa—son of Drupad, Dhrishtadyumna; tava—by your; śiṣyeṇa—disciple; dhīmatā—intelligent

text:
अत्र शूरा महेष्वासा भीमार्जुनसमा युधि।

युयुधानो विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः।।1.4।।
title: Verse 4
transliteration: atra śūrā maheṣvāsā bhīmārjunasamā yudhi yuyudhāno virāṭaśca drupadaśca mahārathaḥ
word_meanings: atra—here; śūrā—powerful warriors; maheṣvāsā—great bowmen; bhīmarjunasamā—equal to Bheem and Arjun; yudhi—in military prowess; yuyudhāno—Yuyudhan; virāṭaḥ—Virat; ca—and; drupadaḥ—Drupad; ca—also; mahārathaḥ—warriors who could single handedly match the strength of ten thousand ordinary warriors

text:
धृष्टकेतुश्चेकितानः काशिराजश्च वीर्यवान्।

पुरुजित्कुन्तिभोजश्च शैब्यश्च नरपुङ्गवः।।1.5।।
title: Verse 5
transliteration: dhṛṣṭaketuścekitānaḥ kāśirājaśca vīryavān purujitkuntibhojaśca śaibyaśca narapuṅgavaḥ
word_meanings: dhṛṣṭaketuḥ—Dhrishtaketu; cekitānaḥ—Chekitan; kāśirājaḥ—Kashiraj; ca—and; vīryavān—heroic; purujit—Purujit; kuntibhojaḥ—Kuntibhoj; ca—and; śaibyaḥ—Shaibya; ca—and; narapuṅgavaḥ—best of men

text:
युधामन्युश्च विक्रान्त उत्तमौजाश्च वीर्यवान्।

सौभद्रो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्व एव महारथाः।।1.6।।
title: Verse 6
transliteration: yudhāmanyuśca vikrānta uttamaujāśca vīryavān saubhadro draupadeyāśca sarva eva mahārathāḥ
word_meanings: yudhāmanyuḥ—Yudhamanyu; ca—and; vikrānta—courageous; uttamaujāḥ—Uttamauja; ca—and; vīryavān—gallant; saubhadro—the son of Subhadra; draupadeyāḥ—the sons of Draupadi; ca—and; sarva—all; eva—indeed; mahārathāḥ—warriors who could single handedly match the strength of ten thousand ordinary warriors

text:
अस्माकं तु विशिष्टा ये तान्निबोध द्विजोत्तम।

नायका मम सैन्यस्य संज्ञार्थं तान्ब्रवीमि ते।।1.7।।
title: Verse 7
transliteration: asmākaṃ tu viśiṣṭā ye tānnibodha dvijottama nāyakā mama sainyasya saṃjñārthaṃ tānbravīmi te
word_meanings: asmākaṃ—ours; tu—but; viśiṣṭā—special; ye—who; tān—them; nibodha—be informed; dvijottama—best of Brahmnis; nāyakā—principal generals; mama—our; sainyasya—of army; sanjñārthaṃ—for information; tān—them; bravīmi—I recount; te—unto you

text:
भवान्भीष्मश्च कर्णश्च कृपश्च समितिञ्जयः।

अश्वत्थामा विकर्णश्च सौमदत्तिस्तथैव च।।1.8।।
title: Verse 8
transliteration: bhavānbhīṣmaśca karṇaśca kṛpaśca samitiñjayaḥ aśvatthāmā vikarṇaśca saumadattistathaiva ca
word_meanings: bhavān—yourself; bhīṣmaḥ—Bheeshma; ca—and; karṇaḥ—Karna; ca—and; kṛpaḥ—Kripa; ca—and; samitiñjayaḥ—victorious in battle; aśvatthāmā—Ashvatthama; vikarṇaḥ—Vikarna; ca—and; saumadatti—Bhurishrava; stathā—thus; eva—even; ca—also

text:
अन्ये च बहवः शूरा मदर्थे त्यक्तजीविताः।

नानाशस्त्रप्रहरणाः सर्वे युद्धविशारदाः।।1.9।।
title: Verse 9
transliteration: anye ca bahavaḥ śūrā madarthe tyaktajīvitāḥ nānāśastrapraharaṇāḥ sarve yuddhaviśāradāḥ
word_meanings: anye—others; ca—also; bahavaḥ—many; śūrā—heroic warriors; madarthe—for my sake; tyaktajīvitāḥ—prepared to lay down their lives; nānāśastrapraharaṇāḥ—equipped with various kinds of weapons; sarve—all; yuddhaviśāradāḥ—skilled in the art of warfare

text:
अपर्याप्तं तदस्माकं बलं भीष्माभिरक्षितम्।

पर्याप्तं त्विदमेतेषां बलं भीमाभिरक्षितम्।।1.10।।
title: Verse 10
transliteration: aparyāptaṃ tadasmākaṃ balaṃ bhīṣmābhirakṣitam paryāptaṃ tvidameteṣāṃ balaṃ bhīmābhirakṣitam
word_meanings: aparyāptaṃ—unlimited; tat—that; asmākam—ours; balaṃ—strength; bhīṣma—by Grandsire Bheeshma; abhirakṣitam—safely marshalled; paryāptaṃ—limited; tu—but; idam—this; eteṣāṃ—their; balaṃ—strength; bhīma—Bheem; abhirakṣitam—carefully marshalled

text:
अयनेषु च सर्वेषु यथाभागमवस्थिताः।

भीष्ममेवाभिरक्षन्तु भवन्तः सर्व एव हि।।1.11।।
title: Verse 11
transliteration: ayaneṣu ca sarveṣu yathābhāgamavasthitāḥ bhīṣmamevābhirakṣantu bhavantaḥ sarva eva hi
word_meanings: ayaneṣu—at the strategic points; ca—also; sarveṣu—all; yathābhāgam—in respective position; avasthitāḥ—situated; bhīṣmam—to Grandsire Bheeshma; eva—only; abhirakṣantu—defend; bhavantaḥ—you; sarve—all; eva hi—even as

text:
तस्य संजनयन्हर्षं कुरुवृद्धः पितामहः।

सिंहनादं विनद्योच्चैः शङ्खं दध्मौ प्रतापवान्।।1.12।।
title: Verse 12
transliteration: tasya saṃjanayanharṣaṃ kuruvṛddhaḥ pitāmahaḥ siṃhanādaṃ vinadyoccaiḥ śaṅkhaṃ dadhmau pratāpavān
word_meanings: tasya—his; sañjanayan—causing; harṣam—joy; kuruvṛddhaḥ—the grand old man of the Kuru dynasty (Bheeshma); pitāmahaḥ—grandfather; siṃhanādaṃ—lion’s roar; vinadya—sounding; uccaiḥ—very loudly; śaṅkhaṃ—conch shell; dadhmau—blew; pratāpavān—the glorious

text:
ततः शङ्खाश्च भेर्यश्च पणवानकगोमुखाः।

सहसैवाभ्यहन्यन्त स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत्।।1.13।।
title: Verse 13
transliteration: tataḥ śaṅkhāśca bheryaśca paṇavānakagomukhāḥ sahasaivābhyahanyanta sa śabdastumulo'bhavat
word_meanings: tataḥ—thereafter; śaṅkhāḥ—conches; ca—and; bheryaḥ—bugles; ca—and; paṇavānaka—drums and kettledrums; gomukhāḥ—trumpets; sahasā—suddenly; eva—indeed; abhyahanyanta—blared forth; sa—that; śabdaḥ—sound; tumulo—overwhelming; abhavat—was

text:
ततः श्वेतैर्हयैर्युक्ते महति स्यन्दने स्थितौ।

माधवः पाण्डवश्चैव दिव्यौ शङ्खौ प्रदध्मतुः।।1.14।।
title: Verse 14
transliteration: tataḥ śvetairhayairyukte mahati syandane sthitau mādhavaḥ pāṇḍavaścaiva divyau śaṅkhau pradadhmatuḥ
word_meanings: tataḥ—then; śvetaiḥ—by white; hayaiḥ—horses; yukte—yoked; mahati—glorious; syandane—chariot; sthitau—seated; mādhavaḥ—Shree Krishna, the husband of the goddess of fortune, Lakshmi; pāṇḍavaḥ—Arjun; ca—and; eva—also; divyau—Divine; śaṅkhau—conch shells; pradadhmatuḥ—blew

text:
पाञ्चजन्यं हृषीकेशो देवदत्तं धनंजयः।

पौण्ड्रं दध्मौ महाशङ्खं भीमकर्मा वृकोदरः।।1.15।।
title: Verse 15
transliteration: pāñcajanyaṃ hṛṣīkeśo devadattaṃ dhanaṃjayaḥ pauṇḍraṃ dadhmau mahāśaṅkhaṃ bhīmakarmā vṛkodaraḥ
word_meanings: pāñcajanyaṃ—the conch shell named Panchajanya; hṛṣīkeśo—Shree Krishna, the Lord of the mind and senses; devadattaṃ—the conch shell named Devadutta; dhanamjayaḥ—Arjun, the winner of wealth; pauṇḍraṃ—the conch named Paundra; dadhmau—blew; mahāśaṅkhaṃ—mighty conch; bhīmakarmā—one who performs herculean tasks; vṛkaudaraḥ—Bheem, the voracious eater

text:
अनन्तविजयं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः।

नकुलः सहदेवश्च सुघोषमणिपुष्पकौ।।1.16।।
title: Verse 16
transliteration: anantavijayaṃ rājā kuntīputro yudhiṣṭhiraḥ nakulaḥ sahadevaśca sughoṣamaṇipuṣpakau
word_meanings: anantavijayaṃ—the conch named Anantavijay; rājā—king; kuntīputro—son of Kunti; yudhiṣṭhiraḥ—Yudhishthir; nakulaḥ—Nakul; sahadevaḥ—Sahadev; ca—and; sughoṣamaṇipuṣpakau—the conche shells named Sughosh and Manipushpak

text:
काश्यश्च परमेष्वासः शिखण्डी च महारथः।

धृष्टद्युम्नो विराटश्च सात्यकिश्चापराजितः।।1.17।।
title: Verse 17
transliteration: kāśyaśca parameṣvāsaḥ śikhaṇḍī ca mahārathaḥ dhṛṣṭadyumno virāṭaśca sātyakiścāparājitaḥ
word_meanings: kāśyaḥ—King of Kashi; ca—and; parameṣvāsaḥ—the excellent archer; śikhaṇḍī—Shikhandi; ca—also; mahārathaḥ—warriors who could single handedly match the strength of ten thousand ordinary warriors; dhṛṣṭadyumno—Dhrishtadyumna; virāṭaḥ—Virat; ca—and; sātyakiḥ—Satyaki; ca—and; aparājitaḥ—invincible

text:
द्रुपदो द्रौपदेयाश्च सर्वशः पृथिवीपते।

सौभद्रश्च महाबाहुः शङ्खान्दध्मुः पृथक्पृथक्।।1.18।।
title: Verse 18
transliteration: drupado draupadeyāśca sarvaśaḥ pṛthivīpate saubhadraśca mahābāhuḥ śaṅkhāndadhmuḥ pṛthakpṛthak
word_meanings: drupado—Drupad; draupadeyāḥ—the five sons of Draupadi; ca—and; sarvaśaḥ—all; pṛthivīpate—Ruler of the earth; saubhadraḥ—Abhimanyu, the son of Subhadra; ca—also; mahābāhuḥ—the mighty-armed; śaṅkhān—conch shells; dadhmuḥ—blew; pṛthak pṛthak—individually

text:
स घोषो धार्तराष्ट्राणां हृदयानि व्यदारयत्।

नभश्च पृथिवीं चैव तुमुलो व्यनुनादयन्।।1.19।।
title: Verse 19
transliteration: sa ghoṣo dhārtarāṣṭrāṇāṃ hṛdayāni vyadārayat nabhaśca pṛthivīṃ caiva tumulo vyanunādayan
word_meanings: sa—that; ghoṣo—sound; dhārtarāṣṭrāṇāṃ—of Dhritarashtra’s sons; hṛdayāni—hearts; vyadārayat—shattered; nabhaḥ—the sky; ca—and; pṛthivīm—the earth; ca—and; eva—certainly; tumula—terrific sound; vyanunādayan—thundering

text:
अथ व्यवस्थितान् दृष्ट्वा धार्तराष्ट्रान्कपिध्वजः।

प्रवृत्ते शस्त्रसंपाते धनुरुद्यम्य पाण्डवः।।1.20।।
title: Verse 20
transliteration: atha vyavasthitān dṛṣṭvā dhārtarāṣṭrānkapidhvajaḥ pravṛtte śastrasaṃpāte dhanurudyamya pāṇḍavaḥ
word_meanings: atha—thereupon; vyavasthitān—arrayed; dṛṣṭvā—seeing; dhārtarāṣṭrān—Dhritarashtra’s sons; kapidwajaḥ—the Monkey Bannered; pravṛtte—about to commence; śastrasampāte—to use the weapons; dhanur—bow; udyamya—taking up; pāṇḍavaḥ—Arjun, the son of Pandu; hṛṣīkeśam—to Shree Krishna; tadā—at that time; vākyam—words; idam—these; āha—said; mahīpate—King

text:
अर्जुन उवाच

हृषीकेशं तदा वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते।

सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये रथं स्थापय मेऽच्युत।।1.21।।
title: Verse 21
transliteration: arjuna uvāca hṛṣīkeśaṃ tadā vākyamidamāha mahīpate senayorubhayormadhye rathaṃ sthāpaya me'cyuta
word_meanings: arjuna uvāca—Arjun said; hṛṣīkeśaṃ—to Shree Krishna; tadā—at that time; vākyam—words; idam—these; āha—said; mahīpate—King; senayoḥ—armies; ubhayoḥ—both; madhye—in the middle; ratham—chariot; sthāpaya—place; me—my; acyuta—Shree Krishna, the infallible One

text:
यावदेतान्निरीक्षेऽहं योद्धुकामानवस्थितान्।

कैर्मया सह योद्धव्यमस्मिन्रणसमुद्यमे।।1.22।।
title: Verse 22
transliteration: yāvadetānnirīkṣe'haṃ yoddhukāmānavasthitān kairmayā saha yoddhavyamasminraṇasamudyame
word_meanings: yāvat—as many as; etān—these; nirīkṣe—look; aham—I; yoddhukāmān—for the battle; avasthitān—arrayed; kaiḥ—with whom; mayā—by me; saha—together; yoddhavyam—must fight; asmin—in this; raṇasamudyame—great combat

text:
योत्स्यमानानवेक्षेऽहं य एतेऽत्र समागताः।

धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्बुद्धेर्युद्धे प्रियचिकीर्षवः।।1.23।।
title: Verse 23
transliteration: yotsyamānānavekṣe'haṃ ya ete'tra samāgatāḥ dhārtarāṣṭrasya durbuddheryuddhe priyacikīrṣavaḥ
word_meanings: yotsyamānān—those who have come to fight; avekṣe haṃ—I desire to see; ye—who; ete—those; atra—here; samāgatāḥ—assembled; dhārtarāṣṭrasya—of Dhritarashtra’s son; durbuddheḥ—evil-minded; yuddhe—in the fight; pṛyacikīrṣavaḥ—wishing to please

text:
संजय उवाच

एवमुक्तो हृषीकेशो गुडाकेशेन भारत।

सेनयोरुभयोर्मध्ये स्थापयित्वा रथोत्तमम्।।1.24।।
title: Verse 24
transliteration: sañjaya uvāca evamukto hṛṣīkeśo guḍākeśena bhārata senayorubhayormadhye sthāpayitvā rathottamam
word_meanings: sañjaya uvāca—Sanjay said; evam—thus; ukto—addressed; hṛṣīkeśo—Shree Krishna, the Lord of the senses; guḍākeśena—by Arjun, the conqueror of sleep; bhārata—descendant of Bharat; senayoḥ—armies; ubhayoḥ—the two; madhye—between; sthāpayitvā—having drawn; rathauttamam—magnificent chariot

text:
भीष्मद्रोणप्रमुखतः सर्वेषां च महीक्षिताम्।

उवाच पार्थ पश्यैतान्समवेतान्कुरूनिति।।1.25।।
title: Verse 25
transliteration: bhīṣmadroṇapramukhataḥ sarveṣāṃ ca mahīkṣitām uvāca pārtha paśyaitānsamavetānkurūniti
word_meanings: bhīṣma—Grandsire Bheeshma; droṇa—Dronacharya; pramukhataḥ—in the presence; sarveṣāṃ—all; ca—and; mahīkṣitām—other kings; uvāca—said; pārtha—Arjun, the son of Pritha; paśya—behold; etān—these; samavetān—gathered; kurūn—descendants of Kuru; iti—thus

text:
तत्रापश्यत्स्थितान्पार्थः पितृ़नथ पितामहान्।

आचार्यान्मातुलान्भ्रातृ़न्पुत्रान्पौत्रान्सखींस्तथा।।1.26।।
title: Verse 26
transliteration: tatrāpaśyatsthitānpārthaḥ pitṛ़natha pitāmahān ācāryānmātulānbhrātṛ़nputrānpautrānsakhīṃstathā
word_meanings: tatra—there; apaśyat—saw; sthitān—stationed; pārthaḥ—Arjun; pitṝīn—fathers; atha—thereafter; pitāmahān—grandfathers; ācāryān—teachers; mātulān—maternal uncles; bhrātṝīn—brothers; putrān—sons; pautrān—grandsons; sakhīn—friends; tathā—also

text:
श्वशुरान्सुहृदश्चैव सेनयोरुभयोरपि।

तान्समीक्ष्य स कौन्तेयः सर्वान्बन्धूनवस्थितान्।।1.27।।
title: Verse 27
transliteration: śvaśurānsuhṛdaścaiva senayorubhayorapi tānsamīkṣya sa kaunteyaḥ sarvānbandhūnavasthitān

वशे हि यस्येन्द्रियाणि तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता।।2.61।।
title: Verse 108

सङ्गात् संजायते कामः कामात्क्रोधोऽभिजायते।।2.62।।
title: Verse 109
transliteration: dhyāyato viṣayānpuṃsaḥ saṅgasteṣūpajāyate saṅgāt saṃjāyate kāmaḥ kāmātkrodho'bhijāyate

स्मृतिभ्रंशाद् बुद्धिनाशो बुद्धिनाशात्प्रणश्यति।।2.63।।

text:
रागद्वेषवियुक्तैस्तु विषयानिन्द्रियैश्चरन्।

आत्मवश्यैर्विधेयात्मा प्रसादमधिगच्छति।।2.64।।

प्रसन्नचेतसो ह्याशु बुद्धिः पर्यवतिष्ठते।।2.65।।
title: Verse 112
transliteration: prasāde sarvaduḥkhānāṃ hānirasyopajāyate prasannacetaso hyāśu buddhiḥ paryavatiṣṭhate
word_meanings: prasāde—by divine grace; sarva—all; duḥkhānām—of sorrows; hāniḥ—destruction; asya—his; upajāyate—comes; prasannacetaso—with a tranquil mind; hi—indeed; āśu—soon; buddhiḥ—intellect; paryavatiṣṭhate—becomes firmly established

न चाभावयतः शान्तिरशान्तस्य कुतः सुखम्।।2.66।।
title: Verse 113
transliteration: nāsti buddhirayuktasya na cāyuktasya bhāvanā na cābhāvayataḥ śāntiraśāntasya kutaḥ sukham

इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते।

तदस्य हरति प्रज्ञां वायुर्नावमिवाम्भसि।।2.67।।

तस्माद्यस्य महाबाहो निगृहीतानि सर्वशः।

इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेभ्यस्तस्य प्रज्ञा प्रतिष्ठिता।।2.68।।

यस्यां जाग्रति भूतानि सा निशा पश्यतो मुनेः।।2.69।।
title: Verse 116

आपूर्यमाणमचलप्रतिष्ठं

समुद्रमापः प्रविशन्ति यद्वत्।

तद्वत्कामा यं प्रविशन्ति सर्वे

स शान्तिमाप्नोति न कामकामी।।2.70।।

transliteration: āpūryamāṇamacalapratiṣṭhaṃ samudramāpaḥ praviśanti yadvat tadvatkāmā yaṃ praviśanti sarve sa śāntimāpnoti na kāmakāmī

विहाय कामान्यः सर्वान्पुमांश्चरति निःस्पृहः।

निर्ममो निरहंकारः स शांतिमधिगच्छति।।2.71।।
title: Verse 118

स्थित्वाऽस्यामन्तकालेऽपि ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृच्छति।।2.72।।

अर्जुन उवाच

ज्यायसी चेत्कर्मणस्ते मता बुद्धिर्जनार्दन।

तत्किं कर्मणि घोरे मां नियोजयसि केशव।।3.1।।

तदेकं वद निश्िचत्य येन श्रेयोऽहमाप्नुयाम्।।3.2।।

लोकेऽस्मिन्द्विविधा निष्ठा पुरा प्रोक्ता मयानघ।

ज्ञानयोगेन सांख्यानां कर्मयोगेन योगिनाम्।।3.3।।
title: Verse 122

न च संन्यसनादेव सिद्धिं समधिगच्छति।।3.4।।

कार्यते ह्यवशः कर्म सर्वः प्रकृतिजैर्गुणैः।।3.5।।

इन्द्रियार्थान्विमूढात्मा मिथ्याचारः स उच्यते।।3.6।।
title: Verse 125

कर्मेन्द्रियैः कर्मयोगमसक्तः स विशिष्यते।।3.7।।

शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिद्ध्येदकर्मणः।।3.8।।
title: Verse 127
transliteration: niyataṃ kuru karma tvaṃ karma jyāyo hyakarmaṇaḥ śarīrayātrāpi ca te na prasiddhyedakarmaṇaḥ
word_meanings: niyatam—constantly; kuru—perform; karma—Vedic duties; tvam—you; karma—action; jyāyaḥ—superior; hi—certainly; akarmaṇaḥ—than inaction; śarīra—bodily; yātrā—maintenance; api—even; ca—and; te—your; na prasiddhyet—would not be possible; akarmaṇaḥ—inaction

text:
यज्ञार्थात्कर्मणोऽन्यत्र लोकोऽयं कर्मबन्धनः।

तदर्थं कर्म कौन्तेय मुक्तसंगः समाचर।।3.9।।

text:

अनेन प्रसविष्यध्वमेष वोऽस्त्विष्टकामधुक्।।3.10।।
title: Verse 129

देवान्भावयतानेन ते देवा भावयन्तु वः।

परस्परं भावयन्तः श्रेयः परमवाप्स्यथ।।3.11।।
title: Verse 130
transliteration: devānbhāvayatānena te devā bhāvayantu vaḥ parasparaṃ bhāvayantaḥ śreyaḥ paramavāpsyatha
word_meanings: devān—celestial gods; bhāvayatā—will be pleased; anena—by these (sacrifices); te—those; devāḥ—celestial gods; bhāvayantu—will be pleased; vaḥ—you; parasparam—one another; bhāvayantaḥ—pleasing one another; śreyaḥ—prosperity; param—the supreme; avāpsyatha—shall achieve

text:
इष्टान्भोगान्हि वो देवा दास्यन्ते यज्ञभाविताः।

तैर्दत्तानप्रदायैभ्यो यो भुङ्क्ते स्तेन एव सः।।3.12।।
title: Verse 131
transliteration: iṣṭānbhogānhi vo devā dāsyante yajñabhāvitāḥ tairdattānapradāyaibhyo yo bhuṅkte stena eva saḥ

भुञ्जते ते त्वघं पापा ये पचन्त्यात्मकारणात्।।3.13।।

अन्नाद्भवन्ति भूतानि पर्जन्यादन्नसम्भवः।

यज्ञाद्भवति पर्जन्यो यज्ञः कर्मसमुद्भवः।।3.14।।
title: Verse 133

तस्मात्सर्वगतं ब्रह्म नित्यं यज्ञे प्रतिष्ठितम्।।3.15।।

अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति।।3.16।।

कथमेतद्विजानीयां त्वमादौ प्रोक्तवानिति।।4.4।।

तान्यहं वेद सर्वाणि न त्वं वेत्थ परन्तप।।4.5।।

प्रकृतिं स्वामधिष्ठाय संभवाम्यात्ममायया।।4.6।।

परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम्।

धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय संभवामि युगे युगे।।4.8।।

त्यक्त्वा देहं पुनर्जन्म नैति मामेति सोऽर्जुन।।4.9।।

ये यथा मां प्रपद्यन्ते तांस्तथैव भजाम्यहम्।

क्षिप्रं हि मानुषे लोके सिद्धिर्भवति कर्मजा।।4.12।।

text:
श्री भगवानुवाच

पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते।

नहि कल्याणकृत्कश्िचद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति।।6.40।।
title: Verse 273
transliteration: śrī bhagavānuvāca pārtha naiveha nāmutra vināśastasya vidyate nahi kalyāṇakṛtkaśicaddurgatiṃ tāta gacchati
word_meanings: śrībhagavān uvāca—the Supreme Lord said; pārtha—Arjun, the son of Pritha; na eva—never; iha—in this world; na—never; amutra—in the next world; vināśaḥ—destruction; tasya—his; vidyate—exists; na—never; hi—certainly; kalyāṇakṛt—one who strives for God-realization; kaścit—anyone; durgatim—evil destination; tāta—my friend; gacchati—goes

text:
प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः।

शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते।।6.41।।
title: Verse 274
transliteration: prāpya puṇyakṛtāṃ lokānuṣitvā śāśvatīḥ samāḥ śucīnāṃ śrīmatāṃ gehe yogabhraṣṭo'bhijāyate
word_meanings: prāpya—attain; puṇyakṛtām—of the virtuous; lokān—abodes; uṣitvā—after dwelling; śāśvatīḥ—many; samāḥ—ages; śucīnām—of the pious; śrīmatām—of the prosperous; gehe—in the house; yogabhraṣṭaḥ—the unsuccessful yogis; abhijāyate—take birth

text:
अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम्।

एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम्।।6.42।।
title: Verse 275
transliteration: athavā yogināmeva kule bhavati dhīmatām etaddhi durlabhataraṃ loke janma yadīdṛśam
word_meanings: atha vā—else; yoginām—of those endowed with divine wisdom; eva—certainly; kule—in the family; bhavati—take birth; dhīmatām—of the wise; etat—this; hi—certainly; durlabhataram—very rare; loke—in this world; janma—birth; yat—which; īdṛśam—like this

text:
तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम्।

यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन।।6.43।।
title: Verse 276
transliteration: tatra taṃ buddhisaṃyogaṃ labhate paurvadehikam yatate ca tato bhūyaḥ saṃsiddhau kurunandana
word_meanings: tatra—there; tam—that; buddhisanyogam—reawaken their wisdom; labhate—obtains; paurvadehikam—from the previous lives; yatate—strives; ca—and; tataḥ—thereafter; bhūyaḥ—again; sansiddhau—for perfection; kurunandana—Arjun, descendant of the Kurus

text:
पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः।

जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते।।6.44।।
title: Verse 277
transliteration: pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hyavaśo'pi saḥ jijñāsurapi yogasya śabdabrahmātivartate
word_meanings: pūrva—past; abhyāsena—discipline; tena—by that; eva—certainly; hṛyate—is attracted; hi—surely; avaśaḥ—helplessly; api—although; sa—that person; jijñāsuḥ—inquisitive; api—even; yogasya—about yog; śabdabrahma—fruitive portion of the Vedas; ativartate—transcends

text:
प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः।

अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम्।।6.45।।
title: Verse 278
transliteration: prayatnādyatamānastu yogī saṃśuddhakilbiṣaḥ anekajanmasaṃsiddhastato yāti parāṃ gatim
word_meanings: prayatnāt—with great effort; yatamānaḥ—endeavoring; tu—and; yogī—a yogi; sanśuddha—purified; kilbiṣaḥ—from material desires; aneka—after many, many; janma—births; sansiddhaḥ—attain perfection; tataḥ—then; yāti—attains; parām—the highest; gatim—path

text:
तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः।

कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन।।6.46।।
title: Verse 279
transliteration: tapasvibhyo'dhiko yogī jñānibhyo'pi mato'dhikaḥ karmibhyaścādhiko yogī tasmādyogī bhavārjuna
word_meanings: tapasvibhyaḥ—than the ascetics; adhikaḥ—superior; yogī—a yogi; jñānibhyaḥ—than the persons of learning; api—even; mataḥ—considered; adhikaḥ—superior; karmibhyaḥ—than the ritualistic performers; ca—and; adhikaḥ—superior; yogī—a yogi; tasmāt—therefore; yogī—a yogi; bhava—just become; arjuna—Arjun

text:
योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना।

श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः।।6.47।।
title: Verse 280
transliteration: yogināmapi sarveṣāṃ madgatenāntarātmanā śraddhāvānbhajate yo māṃ sa me yuktatamo mataḥ
word_meanings: yoginām—of all yogis; api—however; sarveṣām—all types of; matgatena—absorbed in me (God); antaḥ—inner; ātmanā—with the mind; śraddhāvān—with great faith; bhajate—engage in devotion; yaḥ—who; mām—to me; saḥ—he; me—by me; yuktatamaḥ—the highest yogi; mataḥ—is considered

text:
श्री भगवानुवाच

मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः।

असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु।।7.1।।
title: Verse 281
transliteration: śrī bhagavānuvāca mayyāsaktamanāḥ pārtha yogaṃ yuñjanmadāśrayaḥ asaṃśayaṃ samagraṃ māṃ yathā jñāsyasi tacchṛṇu
word_meanings: śrībhagavān uvāca—the Supreme Lord said; mayi—to me; āsaktamanāḥ—with the mind attached; pārtha—Arjun, the son of Pritha; yogam—bhakti yog; yuñjan—practicing; matāśrayaḥ—surrendering to me; asanśayam—free from doubt; samagram—completely; mām—me; yathā—how; jñāsyasi—you shall know; tat—that; śṛṇu—listen

text:
ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः।

यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते।।7.2।।
title: Verse 282
transliteration: jñānaṃ te'haṃ savijñānamidaṃ vakṣyāmyaśeṣataḥ yajjñātvā neha bhūyo'nyajjñātavyamavaśiṣyate
word_meanings: jñānam—knowledge; te—unto you; aham—I; sa—with; vijñānam—wisdom; idam—this; vakṣyāmi—shall reveal; aśeṣataḥ—in full; yat—which; jñātvā—having known; na—not; iha—in this world; bhūyaḥ—further; anyat—anything else; jñātavyam—to be known; avaśiṣyate—remains

text:
मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्िचद्यतति सिद्धये।

यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्िचन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः।।7.3।।
title: Verse 283
transliteration: manuṣyāṇāṃ sahasreṣu kaśicadyatati siddhaye yatatāmapi siddhānāṃ kaśicanmāṃ vetti tattvataḥ
word_meanings: manuṣyāṇām—of men; sahasreṣu—out of many thousands; kaścit—someone; yatati—strives; siddhaye—for perfection; yatatām—of those who strive; api—even; siddhānām—of those who have achieved perfection; kaścit—someone; mām—me; vetti—knows; tattvataḥ—in truth

text:
भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च।

अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा।।7.4।।
title: Verse 284
transliteration: bhūmirāpo'nalo vāyuḥ khaṃ mano buddhireva ca ahaṅkāra itīyaṃ me bhinnā prakṛtiraṣṭadhā
word_meanings: bhūmiḥ—earth; āpaḥ—water; analaḥ—fire; vāyuḥ—air; kham—space; manaḥ—mind; buddhiḥ—intellect; eva—certainly; ca—and; ahankāraḥ—ego; iti—thus; iyam—all these; me—my; bhinnā—divisions; prakṛtiḥ—material energy; aṣṭadhā—eightfold

text:
अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम्।

जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत्।।7.5।।
title: Verse 285
transliteration: apareyamitastvanyāṃ prakṛtiṃ viddhi me parām jīvabhūtāṃ mahābāho yayedaṃ dhāryate jagat
word_meanings: aparā—inferior; iyam—this; itaḥ—besides this; tu—but; anyām—another; prakṛtim—energy; viddhi—know; me—my; parām—superior; jīvabhūtām—living beings; mahābāho—mighty-armed one; yayā—by whom; idam—this; dhāryate—the basis; jagat—the material world

text:
एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय।

अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा।।7.6।।
title: Verse 286
transliteration: etadyonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇītyupadhāraya ahaṃ kṛtsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayastathā
word_meanings: etat yonīni—these two (energies) are the source of; bhūtāni—living beings; sarvāṇi—all; iti—that; upadhāraya—know; aham—I; kṛtsnasya—entire; jagataḥ—creation; prabhavaḥ—the source; pralayaḥ—dissolution; tathā—and

text:
मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय।

मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव।।7.7।।
title: Verse 287
transliteration: mattaḥ parataraṃ nānyatkiñcidasti dhanañjaya mayi sarvamidaṃ protaṃ sūtre maṇigaṇā iva
word_meanings: mattaḥ—than me; parataram—superior; na—not; anyat kiñcit—anything else; asti—there is; dhanañjaya—Arjun, conqueror of wealth; mayi—in me; sarvam—all; idam—which we see; protam—is strung; sūtre—on a thread; maṇigaṇāḥ—beads; iva—like

text:
रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः।

प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु।।7.8।।
title: Verse 288
transliteration: raso'hamapsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śaśisūryayoḥ praṇavaḥ sarvavedeṣu śabdaḥ khe pauruṣaṃ nṛṣu
word_meanings: rasaḥ—taste; aham—I; apsu—in water; kaunteya—Arjun, the son of Kunti; prabhā—the radiance; asmi—I am; śaśisūryayoḥ—of the moon and the sun; praṇavaḥ—the sacred syllable Om; sarva—in all; vedeṣu—Vedas; śabdaḥ—sound; khe—in ether; pauruṣam—ability; nṛṣu—in humans

text:
पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ।

जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु।।7.9।।
title: Verse 289
transliteration: puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛthivyāṃ ca tejaścāsmi vibhāvasau jīvanaṃ sarvabhūteṣu tapaścāsmi tapasviṣu
word_meanings: puṇyaḥ—pure; gandhaḥ—fragrance; pṛthivyām—of the earth; ca—and; tejaḥ—brilliance; ca—and; asmi—I am; vibhāvasau—in the fire; jīvanam—the life-force; sarva—in all; bhūteṣu—beings; tapaḥ—penance; ca—and; asmi—I am; tapasviṣu—of the ascetics

text:
बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम्।

बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्।।7.10।।
title: Verse 290
transliteration: bījaṃ māṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ viddhi pārtha sanātanam buddhirbuddhimatāmasmi tejastejasvināmaham
word_meanings: bījam—the seed; mām—me; sarvabhūtānām—of all beings; viddhi—know; pārtha—Arjun, the son of Pritha; sanātanam—the eternal; buddhiḥ—intellect; buddhimatām—of the intelligent; asmi—(I) am; tejaḥ—splendor; tejasvinām—of the splendid; aham—I

text:
बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम्।

धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ।।7.11।।
title: Verse 291
transliteration: balaṃ balavatāṃ cāhaṃ kāmarāgavivarjitam dharmāviruddho bhūteṣu kāmo'smi bharatarṣabha
word_meanings: balam—strength; balavatām—of the strong; ca—and; aham—I; kāma—desire; rāga—passion; vivarjitam—devoid of; dharmaaviruddhaḥ—not conflicting with dharma; bhūteṣu—in all beings; kāmaḥ—sexual activity; asmi—(I) am; bharataṛṣabha—Arjun, the best of the Bharats

text:
ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये।

मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि नत्वहं तेषु ते मयि।।7.12।।
title: Verse 292
transliteration: ye caiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasāstāmasāśca ye matta eveti tānviddhi natvahaṃ teṣu te mayi
word_meanings: ye—whatever; ca—and; eva—certainly; sāttvikāḥ—in the mode of goodness; bhāvāḥ—states of material existence; rājasāḥ—in the mode of passion; tāmasāḥ—in the mode of ignorance; ca—and; ye—whatever; mattaḥ—from me; eva—certainly; iti—thus; tān—those; viddhi—know; na—not; tu—but; aham—I; teṣu—in them; te—they; mayi—in me

text:
त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत्।

मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम्।।7.13।।
title: Verse 293
transliteration: tribhirguṇamayairbhāvairebhiḥ sarvamidaṃ jagat mohitaṃ nābhijānāti māmebhyaḥ paramavyayam
word_meanings: tṛbhiḥ—by three; guṇamayaiḥ—consisting of the modes of material nature; bhāvaiḥ—states; ebhiḥ—all these; sarvam—whole; idam—this; jagat—universe; mohitam—deluded; na—not; abhijānāti—know; mām—me; ebhyaḥ—these; param—the supreme; avyayam—imperishable

text:
दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया।

मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते।।7.14।।
title: Verse 294
transliteration: daivī hyeṣā guṇamayī mama māyā duratyayā māmeva ye prapadyante māyāmetāṃ taranti te
word_meanings: daivī—divine; hi—certainly; eṣā—this; guṇamayī—consisting of the three modes of nature; mama—my; māyā—one of God’s energies. It that veils God’s true nature from souls who have not yet attained the eligibility for God-realization; duratyayā—very difficult to overcome; mām—unto me; eva—certainly; ye—who; prapadyante—surrender; māyām etām—this Maya; taranti—cross over; te—they

text:
न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः।

माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः।।7.15।।
title: Verse 295
transliteration: na māṃ duṣkṛtino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ māyayāpahṛtajñānā āsuraṃ bhāvamāśritāḥ
word_meanings: na—not; mām—unto me; duṣkṛtinaḥ—the evil doers; mūḍhāḥ—the ignorant; prapadyante—surrender; naraadhamāḥ—one who lazily follows one’s lower nature; māyayā—by God’s material energy; apahṛta jñānāḥ—those with deluded intellect; āsuram—demoniac; bhāvam—nature; āśṛtāḥ—surrender

text:
चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन।

आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ।।7.16।।
title: Verse 296
transliteration: caturvidhā bhajante māṃ janāḥ sukṛtino'rjuna ārto jijñāsurarthārthī jñānī ca bharatarṣabha
word_meanings: catuḥvidhāḥ—four kinds; bhajante—worship; mām—me; janāḥ—people; sukṛtinaḥ—those who are pious; arjuna—Arjun; ārtaḥ—the distressed; jijñāsuḥ—the seekers of knowledge; arthaarthī—the seekers of material gain; jñānī—those who are situated in knowledge; ca—and; bharataṛṣabha—The best amongst the Bharatas, Arjun

text:
तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्ितर्विशिष्यते।

प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः।।7.17।।
title: Verse 297
transliteration: teṣāṃ jñānī nityayukta ekabhakitarviśiṣyate priyo hi jñānino'tyarthamahaṃ sa ca mama priyaḥ
word_meanings: teṣām—amongst these; jñānī—those who are situated in knowledge; nityayuktaḥ—ever steadfast; eka—exclusively; bhaktiḥ—devotion; viśiṣyate—highest; pṛyaḥ—very dear; hi—certainly; jñāninaḥ—to the person in knowledge; atyartham—highly; aham—I; saḥ—he; ca—and; mama—to me; pṛyaḥ—dear

text:
उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम्।

आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम्।।7.18।।
title: Verse 298
transliteration: udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tvātmaiva me matam āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā māmevānuttamāṃ gatim
word_meanings: udārāḥ—noble; sarve—all; eva—indeed; ete—these; jñānī—those in knowledge; tu—but; ātmā eva—my very self; me—my; matam—opinion; āsthitaḥ—situated; saḥ—he; hi—certainly; yuktaātmā—those who are united; mām—in me; eva—certainly; anuttamām—the supreme; gatim—goal

text:
बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते।

वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः।।7.19।।
title: Verse 299
transliteration: bahūnāṃ janmanāmante jñānavānmāṃ prapadyate vāsudevaḥ sarvamiti sa mahātmā sudurlabhaḥ
word_meanings: bahūnām—many; janmanām—births; ante—after; jñānavān—one who is endowed with knowledge; mām—unto me; prapadyate—surrenders; vāsudevaḥ—Shree Krishna, the son of Vasudev; sarvam—all; iti—that; sa—that; mahāātmā—great soul; sudurlabhaḥ—very rare

text:
कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः।

तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया।।7.20।।
title: Verse 300

word_meanings: rājan—King; sansmṛtya saṃsmṛtya—repeatedly recalling; saṃvādam—dialogue; imam—this; adbhutam—astonishing; keśavaarjunayoḥ—between Lord Shree Krishna and Arjun; puṇyam—pious; hṛṣyāmi—I rejoice; ca—and; muhuḥ muhuḥ—repeatedly

text:
तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः।

विस्मयो मे महान् राजन् हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः।।18.77।।
title: Verse 700
transliteration: tacca saṃsmṛtya saṃsmṛtya rūpamatyadbhutaṃ hareḥ vismayo me mahān rājan hṛṣyāmi ca punaḥ punaḥ
word_meanings: tat—that; ca—and; sansmṛtya saṃsmṛtya—remembering repeatedly; rūpam—cosmic form; ati—most; adbhutam—wonderful; hareḥ—of Lord Krishna; vismayaḥ—astonishment; me—my; mahān—great; rājan—King; hṛṣyāmi—I am thrilled with joy; ca—and; punaḥ punaḥ—over and over again

text:
यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः।

तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम।।18.78।
title: Verse 701
